pullRequest.title: resolve ip address for spring enabler
pullRequest.bodyText:
option to prefer ip address at registration
Signed-off-by: achmelo a.chmelo@gmail.com
Description
Solving issue #668 . Spring enabler will resolve IP address the same way as in PJE. Users have option to prefer IP address for registration to eureka.
Fixes # (issue)
Type of change
Please delete options that are not relevant.

 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 This change requires a documentation update

Checklist:

 My code follows the style guidelines of this project
 I have performed a self-review of my own code
 I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
 I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
 My changes generate no new warnings
 I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
 New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
 Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules

For more details about how should the code look like read the Contributing guideline

commit.message:
resolve ip address for spring enabler
option to prefer ip address at registration

Signed-off-by: achmelo <a.chmelo@gmail.com>

prefer hostname in config

Signed-off-by: achmelo <a.chmelo@gmail.com>

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -12,7 +12,7 @@ apiml:
         serviceId: discoverableclient  # Service ID of this service
         hostname: localhost  # Hostname that is advertised in Eureka. Default is valid only for localhost
         port: 10012  # Default port for discoverable-client service
-        serviceIpAddress: 127.0.0.1  # IP address that is advertised in Eureka. Default is valid only for localhost

nodes.bodyText: Is it possible to revert this change? There is no actual change. It just moves the imports around.
Could we rather move it to some utility class or something instead of making it public and static here?
